text: my mother was a hippy back in the 60s and 70s, and she had a drug habit a mile wide.

text: She was addicted to hard stuff by the time me and my sister were born.

text: And she eventually passed on her addictions to us in one degree or another.

text: Let me just say that being an asprin junkie at the age of 6 is a low point in my life, but Im extremely proud to have beaten it.

text: Well as a kid she used to scare my sister and me with horror stories about the Republican Party and conservatives in general, with the stories about rush Limbaugh being the worst of the lot.

text: In fact it wasnt until just a couple years ago that I could watch a speech by one of their number without wetting myself and shaking in fear.

text: But onto other things well she always was a wonderful cook, with mushrooms and brownies being her specialties, we had those a lot, when there was enough to eat anyways.

text: We were poor but happy, often mother would make us clothes out of flowers and stuff, they were colorful and pretty during the summer and they smelled real good.

text: But when winter came we would be real cold and sometimes our clothes would fall off, which was real bad when we were away from home trying to make some money to help support us.
